laboratory_examinations.procedure_name: Immunophenotype of Peripheral Blood Mononuclear Cells
laboratory_examinations.findings: CD3 at 21.6%, CD4 at 48.4%, CD7 at 47.0%, and CD4+CD7– cells at 27.3%.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Persistent existence of lymphocytes positive for CD4 but negative for CD3, CD7, αβTCR, and γδTCR, which occupied 27% to 48% of PBMCs.

laboratory_examinations.procedure_name: Immunophenotype of Peripheral Blood Mononuclear Cells
laboratory_examinations.findings: CD3 at 23.7%, CD4 at 47.3%, with CD4+CD7– cells at 31.4%; CD3–CD4+ cells at 30.9%; CD4+αβTCR– cells at 31.2%.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: The percentage of CD4+CD7– cells increased to 31.4% and CD3–CD4+ cells to 30.9%.

laboratory_examinations.procedure_name: Immunophenotype of Peripheral Blood Mononuclear Cells
laboratory_examinations.findings: CD3 at 23.2%, CD4 at 51.3%, CD7 at 38.5%, CD4+CD7– cells at 33.3%.

laboratory_examinations.procedure_name: Immunophenotype of Peripheral Blood Mononuclear Cells
laboratory_examinations.findings: CD3 at 17.9%, CD4 at 43.5%, CD4+CD7– cells at 33.9%; CD3–CD4+ cells at 33.7%; CD4+αβTCR– cells at 31.8%.

laboratory_examinations.procedure_name: Immunophenotype of Peripheral Blood Mononuclear Cells
laboratory_examinations.findings: CD3 at 12.4%, CD4 at 56.8%; CD3–CD4+ cells at 48.5%.
Elevation of IgE (1261 IU; normal < 200 IU) and lactate dehydrogenase (496-585 IU; normal 150-460 IU).
Approximately 30% lymphocytes exhibited a relatively large, irregularly shaped nucleus without prominent nucleoli or azurophilic intracytoplasmic granules.
Normal cellularity and no invasion of atypical cells.
